data.title: Excellent Food in a nice Environment
data.text: We have just returned from a trip to the Frederick, Maryland area and had the pleasure of eating at several very nice restaurants. Sumittra may have been our very favorite. It's a small, classy space with a well-chosen menu. There were four of us dining for lunch and all I can say is that each of us sampled all of the dishes. There wasn't a bad choice among the four of us. Service was excellent and the atmosphere was great. We've eaten at many Thai restaurants in the Washington, DC, area and this one stands up very favorably with any of them.

data.title: A Great Find For Lunch
data.text: We were traveling through the area today and came across Sumittra and decided to make this our lunch stop and I'm glad we did. We both got their lunch special which was the Massaman Curry Chicken and it was a nice size portion of great food for less than ten dollars. Great value for great food. Last but far from least... our waitress was very friendly and provided us with outstanding service.

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Pricey for Frederick but worth every delicious bite.  The shrimp appetizer is worth every delicious mouthful!

data.title: Mmmmmmm....goood!
data.text:
Stopped here on a Saturday night - place was busy, but we did not have problems being seated. Service was a tad slow as they may have been understaffed, but when we ordered, the food came quickly & was plenty hot.

My selection was Pad Thai with shrimp (a favorite of mine) & was AWE-SOME. Apps were great, too!

Interior is not the fanciest, but the food is worth it!

I'd return here with no qualms whatsoever!

data.title: Delicious food
data.text: Since I was eating alone I decide to do take out.  I had soup, salad and a main course.  Everything was delicious.  Look forward to going back next time I'm in the area.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text:
The only reason I don't eat here regularly is because they don't serve brown rice, only white rice*. 
The food here is fresh and very good- had a few salads and a curry dish and enjoyed my meal very much.  Our server was friendly and polite.  

C'mon people, white rice= unhealthy junk food; brown rice=good for you and more satisfying!  If more people asked for it this place would have it available.

data.title: Love the Kao Soi
data.text: If you're looking for a small place to eat fantastic Thai food, this is it. Lazy Fish Sushi is it's neighbor. I love going here for the Kao Soi. It's probably one of the best I've had. Their other dishes are also fantastic as well (I haven't tried other ones but my dinner dates have never been dissatisfied).

data.title: Good job!
data.text: We have been to Sumittra several times in the past couple months. It's small and intimate and the food is great! One of those places you crave. Wait staff is amazingly friendly.

data.title: Delicious with friendly service
data.text: Dinner for 4 on a Friday night.  It was crowded, but we got a table with no wait.  The service was friendly and helpful, accommodating a couple of special requests.  Superb meals all around.  It is a little loud, but most restaurants are these days.  We would definitely return.

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Very nice, downtown restaurant with great service and fantastic food. We definitely will be returning soon! Lovely evening.

data.title: Excellent Meal
data.text: Enjoyed a wonderful meal here. Started with the dumplings, which were delicious with lots of fresh ginger. Shared this plus an order of Pad Thai noodles and Red Curry Mango Chicken with two friends, and it was the perfect amount of food. Everything was served hot. The ingredients were fresh, the vegetables and chicken perfectly cooked. And the presentation was lovely! The tables are small and not the most comfortable for leisurely dining, but the quality of the food more than made up for it.

data.title: Different from typical New England Thai menu
data.text: After 3 months in Florida and a lot of seafood and heading back to Massachusetts my wife let me choose the restaurant; I had an urge for Thai and it was in the top bunch reviewed by TA so we punched the address into the smartphone and headed out.  Parked right outside on the street - smallish interior and not over decorated.  Service was quick and friendly.  My wife ordered the rock shrimp appetizer and the chicken pad thai and loved both of them, especially the rock shrimp.  I had shrimp tom yum soup and the lo mein special (the bill called it drunken lo mein) it came with shrimp and chicken and was flavored with thai basil and it was delicious.  Back home the tom yum option is with or without seafood - the seafood is shrimp, scallops and squid which offers (obviously) a little more variety and it's my preference - this one came with 3 large shrimp and the soup's flavor was different than I'm used to but still quite good.  We'll be back next time in Frederick.

data.title: Some like it Hot
data.text: Working in Frederick for the first time.  Co-workers suggested Sumathi Indian Restaurant Delicious food! Great service.  Good portions for the price and the taste is amazing They will ask you how spicy you want it and if you are new to Indian food, go mild.  Highly recommend this place to anyone who has a craving for some Indian cuisine.

data.title: One of the BEST Restaurants in Frederick!!!
data.text: Sumittra is one of the best places to eat in Frederick! The Thai food is unbelievable tasty and top notch!! The service is always good and the atmosphere is cozy. We enjoy eating in or taking out. Totally recommended!!

data.title: Check the small plate menu
data.text: I ate here off the tapas menu. Larb and crispy wontons. Even got a beer for a total of $14. Good deal for good food. Service was spotty. Had to ask two servers to get my check.

data.title: Always a great dining experience
data.text: Whenever my husband and I go to Frederick we eat here.Sometimes we just come to Frederick to eat here! The food is always delicious and elegantly presented. I have never had anything bad here. The specials of the day are always interesting as well. The service and friendliness of the staff also adds to the experience. In warm weather, it is a treat to sit at the outdoor tables and watch the action on Patrick street. If you like Thai cuisine- don't miss this restaurant!

data.title: Consistently Delicious and Flavorful Food
data.text: Whenever we have a yearning for delicious and flavorful food, we always think of Sumittra Thai, where we visited for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. They offer a wide variety of expertly crafted Thai cuisine dishes.  Each plate is a work of art.  The flavors are authentic, delicious and very well balanced.  As always, we left full and very satisfied.  Try to get a table by the front window.  The people watching is great.

data.title: Outstanding quality!
data.text: Freshly prepared; superb taste; amazing presentation!  We had the volcano shrimp as well as a red curry dish with pork and a coconut curry with chicken. All were top notch!  We will definitely go back again.

data.title: Everything on the menu is incredible. AND they deliver!
data.text: The gang ped yang is to die for. The red curry is something to slap a baby over. Their drunken noodle is fabulous. Really every time you say the word "Sumittra" my mouth waters. Good sized servings too. Great service.

data.title: Cozy
data.text: Good food with interesting twists. The restaurant is very clean. The staff friendly and helpful. Small but cozy.
